Trillian test result (tid-2177) Environment: kvm-centos7 (x2), Advanced Networking with Mgmt server 7 Total time taken: 34943 seconds Marvin logs: https://github.com/blueorangutan/acs-prs/releases/download/trillian/pr2416-t2177-kvm-centos7.zip Intermitten failure detected: /marvin/tests/smoke/test_public_ip_range.py Intermitten failure detected: /marvin/tests/smoke/test_templates.py Intermitten failure detected: /marvin/tests/smoke/test_usage.py Intermitten failure detected: /marvin/tests/smoke/test_volumes.py Intermitten failure detected: /marvin/tests/smoke/test_vpc_redundant.py Intermitten failure detected: /marvin/tests/smoke/test_host_maintenance.py Intermitten failure detected: /marvin/tests/smoke/test_hostha_kvm.py Smoke tests completed. 62 look OK, 5 have error(s) Only failed tests results shown below: Test | Result | Time (s) | Test File --- | --- | --- | --- test_04_extract_template | `Failure` | 128.42 | test_templates.py ContextSuite context=TestISOUsage>:setup | `Error` | 0.00 | test_usage.py test_06_download_detached_volume | `Failure` | 138.71 | test_volumes.py test_02_cancel_host_maintenace_with_migration_jobs | `Error` | 1.41 | test_host_maintenance.py test_hostha_enable_ha_when_host_in_maintenance | `Error` | 3.82 | test_hostha_kvm.py

Test LGTM, the failures were caused by `Intermitten failed test_public_ip_range.py` that added a fake public IP range so volume/template/iso related downloadable links were unreachable, the other failures are env related as well.

Merging this based on code reviews and test results.
@marcaurele can you comment if this was an error in your PR #2283 - migration to maven standard, and review this PR?

I've an outstanding question, other LGTM pending test results.
@blueorangutan package
@rhtyd a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.

Yes, that's possible that some `git mv` commands weren't done correctly. I just ver surprised that the compilation and packaging worked with those...
@blueorangutan package
@rhtyd a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.

@marcaurele I was surprised as well. Not just the compilation that passed, but the tests that were executed. And it was not just about class files in wrong directories. There were classes not compiling at all. It seems that these compilations problems were already there.

no, it doesn't but still, mine compiles

What can I tell you then?
Can you open the class `engine/storage/integration-test/src/test/java/com/cloud/vm/snapshot/dao/VmSnapshotDaoTest.java ` and see if it is compiling in your IDE?

Can you also look these other files?
 plugins/hypervisors/ovm3/src/main/java/com/cloud/hypervisor/ovm3/objects/OvmObject.java
 src/test/java/org/apache/cloudstack/storage/test/VolumeTestVmware.java
I see your point @rafaelweingartner It passing without having compiled those files is a lack of feature. Your changes LGTM
@blueorangutan test
@rhtyd a Trillian-Jenkins test job (centos7 mgmt + kvm-centos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests

I agree with you @DaanHoogland that's it not very elegant. But the way we pass rules to the Python file isn't my favorite either.

The 'NEXT' keyword was the only thing I could split on elegantly without running into troubles.

As @rhtyd mentioned it's all done in *SecurityGroupRulesCmd.java*
@rafaelweingartner I'll send you a PR against your branch with other changes

Sure, no problem.
Is there something else missing?
New checkstyle validation: http://checkstyle.sourceforge.net/config_coding.html#PackageDeclaration
just to make it clear here. @marcaurele is not going to open a PR to this branch. His changes will be introduced in a specific PR to enable checkstyle checks regarding class packages.

The managed-storage test for 4.11 RC1 that failed and led to the creation of the JIRA ticket that this PR addresses now passes:

test_04_create_volume_snapshot_using_sf_snapshot_and_archiving (TestSnapshots.TestSnapshots) ... === TestName: test_04_create_volume_snapshot_using_sf_snapshot_and_archiving | Status : SUCCESS ===
ok

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 1 test in 1931.664s

OK

I have also tested the other failed use case that led to this PR: Take a volume snapshot of a volume. Delete the volume and the primary storage the volume was on. Create a new volume from the volume snapshot. The test is now successful.
The code LGTM. Also, as noted above, I tested both failed use cases that led to this PR and they both work now.
@rhtyd I noticed that you changed the base branch for this PR, from master to 4.11. Do you want me to open a new PR against master? Given that you might run into trouble when merging forward.

@rhtyd done.

The Jira ticket is: CLOUDSTACK-10248

Ok @rhtyd ! The problem is that this doesn't happen on small scale, you need to spawn multiple VMs to run into the issue.

We currently 

The point is that we use p.wait() in the Python code there the Python code already say that should not be used.

What this PR does is change the inner workings for the execute() method so that it uses check_output() which is recommended.
Merging this based on code reviews and test results. LGTM. Will merge as soon as Travis is green.
Danke!

Thanks for the explanation @wido given this is not a blocker, and we cannot accept this in 4.11.0.0-rc2 based on speculative observation, so I've moved it to 4.11.1 milestone. Let's get this tested and merged after the 4.11.0.0 release if you disagree let's discuss on dev@, for example if you're able to reproduce the issue with 4.11.0.0-rc1.
Fine with me @rhtyd !

LGTM, merging based on test results and reviews. The failing tests were caused by a failure in test_public_ip_range.py that introduces a fake public ip range used by systemvms, causing failure on download urls of template/iso/volumes.
